t: To the chief Musician upon Gittith, A Psalm for the sons of Korah.
How*p amiable are thy tabernacles, O Lord*s of hosts!
My*p soul longeth, yea, even fainteth for the courts of the Lord:*s my heart and my flesh crieth out for the living God.
Yea,*p the sparrow hath found an house, and the swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young, even thine altars, O Lord*s of hosts, my King, and my God.
Blessed*p are they that dwell in thy house: they will be still praising thee. Selah.
Blessed*p is the man whose strength is in thee; in whose heart are the ways of them.
Who*p passing through the valley of Baca make it a well; the rain also filleth the pools.
They*p go from strength to strength, every one of them in Zion appeareth before God.
O*p Lord*s God of hosts, hear my prayer: give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah.
Behold,*p O God our shield, and look upon the face of thine anointed.
For*p a day in thy courts is better than a thousand. I had rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God, than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.
For*p the Lord*s God is a sun and shield: the Lord*s will give grace and glory: no good thing will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.
O*p Lord*s of hosts, blessed is the man that trusteth in thee.
